intro: Canthium sarodranense, commonly known as the Madagascar spurge, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, spiny stems and lobed leaves. The plant produces small, greenish flowers that are clustered in complex inflorescences. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in forested areas. Due to its unique morphology and restricted distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
